Domino’s is testing the service in New Zealand

Fast food giant Domino’s will test a robot to deliver pizzas in New Zealand, which could become the world’s first country to use the machine that keeps food hot and drinks cold in its waterproof body while delivering in a 20-km radius, media reports said on Friday.

The hi-tech, autonomous driverless unit named DRU (Domino’s Robotic Unit) was developed in Australia. The New Zealand government has backed the ambitious project.

The robot is just one-metre tall and is equipped with separate compartments to keep pizzas hot and drinks cold while travelling on the footpath “at a safe speed” from the store to the customer’s door.

The robots use sensors to avoid obstacles. — PTI
title: Soon, robots may deliver pizza
